document.title: Hidden-action in multi-hop routing
document.abstract: In any multi-hop routing scheme, cooperation by the intermediate nodes are essential for the succesful delivery of traffic. However, the effort exerted by the intermediate nodes are often unobservable by the source and/or destination nodes. We show it is possible to overcome this problem of hidden action by designing contracts, in the form of payments, to induce cooperation from the intermediate nodes. Interestingly, the ability to monitor per-hop or per-path outcomes, even if costless to implement, may not improve the welfare of the participants or the performance of the network.
